project.name: PixiAnimate
project.description: Runtime library to play Pixi.js content from Adobe Animate CC

params.name: options
params.description: The options object or the mode to play

props.name: mode
props.description: The playback mode default is independent (0),

props.name: labels
props.description: The frame labels map of label to frames

props.name: duration
props.description: The duration, if no duration is provided, auto determines length

props.name: framerate
props.description: The framerate to use for independent mode

params.description: The `<script>` element added to the document

PIXI.animate.FlashArtTask.name: PIXI.animate.FlashArtTask
PIXI.animate.FlashArtTask.description: Loads a FlashArt, making it easier to load and unload PixiAnimate art.

props.description: An array of Image, TextureAtlas, or SpriteSheet assets to load

props.description: If we should cache the result

props.description: The event to call when done

PIXI.animate.MovieClipInstance.name: PIXI.animate.MovieClipInstance
PIXI.animate.MovieClipInstance.description: The SpringRoll plugin for working with MovieClips and SpringRoll's Animator

PIXI.animate.SpriteSheetTask.name: PIXI.animate.SpriteSheetTask
PIXI.animate.SpriteSheetTask.description:
Load a spritesheet generated from Flash and adds it to the global ss namespace.
This namespace is shared with regular CreateJS art, as it can't be changed in Flash's
publishing settings. As such, don't name spritesheets for CreateJS and PixiAnimate the same
thing if both spritesheets are being used by art published from Flash.

props.name: cache
props.description: If we should cache the result

props.name: complete
props.description: The event to call when done

props.name: sizes
props.description: Define if certain sizes are not supported

classitems.description:
Controls how this MovieClip advances its time. Must be one of 0 (INDEPENDENT), 1 (SINGLE_FRAME), or 2 (SYNCHED).
See each constant for a description of the behaviour.
classitems.name: mode

classitems.description: Specifies what the first frame to play in this movieclip, or the only frame to display if mode is SINGLE_FRAME.
classitems.name: startPosition

classitems.description: Indicates whether this MovieClip should loop when it reaches the end of its timeline.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description: The current frame of the movieclip.
classitems.name: currentFrame

classitems.description: If true, this movieclip will animate automatically whenever it is on the stage.
classitems.name: selfAdvance

classitems.description: If true, the MovieClip's position will not advance when ticked.
classitems.name: paused

classitems.description: If true, actions in this MovieClip's tweens will be run when the playhead advances.
classitems.name: actionsEnabled

classitems.description:
If true, the MovieClip will automatically be reset to its first frame whenever the timeline adds it back onto the display list. This only applies to MovieClip instances with mode=INDEPENDENT.

For example, if you had a character animation with a "body" child MovieClip instance with different costumes on each frame, you could set body.autoReset = false, so that you can manually change the frame it is on, without worrying that it will be reset automatically.
classitems.name: autoReset

classitems.description:
Note - changed from default: When the MovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time
elapsed from frame 0 in seconds.
classitems.name: _t

classitems.description:
By default MovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the MovieClip
will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as appropriate to maintain the target
framerate.
classitems.name: _framerate

classitems.description: The total time in seconds for the animation. This is changed when setting the framerate.
classitems.name: _duration

classitems.description: The total duration in frames for the animation.
classitems.name: _totalFrames

classitems.description:
Standard tween timelines for all objects. Each element in the _timelines array
is a Timeline object - an array of tweens for one target, in order of occurrence.
classitems.name: _timelines

classitems.description:
Array of child timelines denoting if a child is actively a child of this movieclip
on any given frame. Each element in the _timedChildTimelines is an array with a 'target'
property, and is an array of boolean values indexed by frame.
classitems.name: _timedChildTimelines

classitems.description: Array of frame scripts, indexed by frame.
classitems.name: _actions

classitems.description:
The MovieClip will advance independently of its parent, even if its parent is paused.
This is the default mode.
classitems.name: INDEPENDENT

classitems.description: The MovieClip will only display a single frame (as determined by the startPosition property).
classitems.name: SINGLE_FRAME

classitems.description:
The MovieClip will be advanced only when its parent advances and will be synched to the position of
the parent MovieClip.
classitems.name: SYNCHED

classitems.description: Returns a sorted list of the labels defined on this AdvancedMovieClip.
classitems.name: getLabels

return.description:
A sorted array of objects with label and position (aka frame)
                       properties.

classitems.description: Returns the name of the label on or immediately before the current frame.
classitems.name: getCurrentLabel

return.description: The name of the current label or null if there is no label.

classitems.description: Returns an array of objects with label and position (aka frame) properties, sorted by position.
classitems.name: labels

classitems.description: Returns the name of the label on or immediately before the current frame.
classitems.name: currentLabel

classitems.description: When the MovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time elapsed from frame 0 in seconds.
classitems.name: elapsedTime

classitems.description:
By default MovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the MovieClip
will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as appropriate to maintain the target
framerate.

For example, if a MovieClip with a framerate of 10 is placed on a Stage being updated at 40fps, then the MovieClip will
advance roughly one frame every 4 ticks. This will not be exact, because the time between each tick will
vary slightly between frames.

This feature is dependent on the tick event object (or an object with an appropriate "delta" property) being
passed into {{#crossLink "Stage/update"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: framerate

classitems.description: Get the total number of frames (duration) of this MovieClip
classitems.name: totalFrames

classitems.description: Convenience method for setting multiple frames at once and adding the child
classitems.name: addKeyframes

params.name: keyframes
params.description: The collection of keyframe objects or data string, the key is frame number

classitems.description: Add a tween to the clip
classitems.name: addTween

params.name: properties
params.description: The property or property to tween

params.name: duration
params.description:
Number of frames to tween. If 0, then the properties are set
                          with no tweening.

params.name: ease
params.description: An optional easing function that takes the tween time from 0-1.

classitems.description: Alias for method `addTween`
classitems.name: tw

classitems.description: Add a child to show for a certain number of frames before automatic removal.
classitems.name: addTimedChild

params.name: duration
params.description: The number of frames to display the child before removing it.

params.name: keyframes
params.description: The collection of static keyframes to add

classitems.description: Alias for method `addTimedChild`
classitems.name: at

classitems.description: Handle frame actions, callback is bound to the instance of the MovieClip
classitems.name: addAction

params.name: callback
params.description: The clip call on a certain frame

classitems.description: Sets paused to false.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: Sets paused to true.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Advances this movie clip to the specified position or label and sets paused to false.
classitems.name: gotoAndPlay

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The animation name or frame number to go to.

classitems.description: Advances this movie clip to the specified position or label and sets paused to true.
classitems.name: gotoAndStop

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The animation or frame name to go to.

classitems.description: Advances the playhead. This occurs automatically each tick by default.

params.name: time
params.description: The amount of time in seconds to advance by. Only applicable if framerate is set.

classitems.name: advance

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The animation name or frame number to go to.

classitems.description:
Adds one or more tweens (or timelines) to this timeline. The tweens will be paused (to remove them from the normal ticking system)
and managed by this timeline. Adding a tween to multiple timelines will result in unexpected behaviour.
classitems.name: addTween

params.name: tween
params.description: The tween(s) to add. Accepts multiple arguments.

return.description: Tween The first tween that was passed in.
